roleset.name: change, cause a change in state
roleset.note: TRANSFORM-V NOTES: Based on big corpus. Member of Vncls turn-26.6.1. comparison with 'change'. (from transform.01-v)
TRANSFORMATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on transform-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls turn-26.6.1. (from transformation.01-n)

roles.note: "Start state" and "thing changing" are usually the same, but there canbe cases where they are separate. Reserve use of Arg3 for these cases. (from transform.01-v)

example.name: agentive
example.text: The commercial transformed the dynamics of the campaign.

example.name: ergative
example.text: ...customers whose addresses have transformed during the past 3 1/2 years.

example.name: passive
example.text: ...[the areas]-1 that can be most easily transformed *trace*-1

example.name: with end state
example.text: ...erasures transformed wrong answers to right ones on a statewide test.

example.name: explicit start state
example.text: Customers transform from borrowers to savers/investors.

example.name: args 1 and 3
example.text: Two weeks in hospital and Ali is recovering fast , happily watching Tom and Jerry on his mini television , his transformation from the pain - wracked boy who left Baghdad .
example.arg: from the pain-wracked boy who left Baghdad

example.name: Lots of argMs
example.text: But in the face of today 's dramatic global economic transformation , there is no choice but to try to turn knowledge into profit .

example.name: with arg 2
example.text: The rapid transformation of important scientific and technological achievements into real productivity is the outstanding feature of this open zone .
example.arg: of important scientific and technological achievments

example.name: with arg0
example.text: The Levi-Larson brand of irreverence doesn't always enthrall me, but their tranformation of Dickens' tale into a night in a phantasmagorical Hard Rock Cafe is irresistible.
example.arg: into a night in a phantasmagorical Hard Rock Cafe
